articles.caption: A look at Wemade's move to be the Steam of web3 games.  I've been saying this but I think the next stage of web3 gaming will resemble large publishers with federated chains rather games on  pure public blockchains
articles.title: How South Korea‚Äôs Wemade aims to become the Steam of blockchain games
articles.description: Most Western gamers haven‚Äôt heard about South Korea‚Äôs Wemade, so you can forgive them for not knowing about the game company‚Äôs big ambitions. Henry Chang, CEO of Wemade, wants to change all that. His ambition is to make Wemade, a company known for its Mir series of online games, into the Steam of blockchain games.¬†[‚Ä¶]

articles.caption: A look at Roll20 + OneBookShelf merger for table-top RPG mania.
articles.title: Roll20 and OneBookShelf are merging into one TTRPG platform
articles.description: Roll20 and OneBookShelf are teaming up to augment the former's PDF support, making a bigger combined platform.

articles.caption: A look at Unity merging with IronSource.  The 3rd & 4th largest ad networks for mobile.  Big deal.
articles.title: Unity merging with IronSource in all-stock deal
articles.description: Unity has struck a merger agreement with app monetisation platform IronSource in a deal that values the company at $4.4 billion.

articles.caption: A look at Eric Seufert's breakdown of the Unity + IronSource deal
articles.title: Why are Unity and ironSource merging? | Mobile Dev Memo by Eric Seufert
articles.description: Why are Unity and ironSource merging?. Mobile marketing and advertising, freemium monetization strategy, and marketing science. Mobile Dev Memo.

articles.caption: A look at Triple A titles going to mobile.  This time it's Ubisoft's but prev we saw  ATVI with CoD Mobile then EA with Apex.
articles.title: Why Ubisoft believes it‚Äôs time for triple-A free-to-play games on mobile
articles.description: Fabrice Navrez of Ubisoft believes the time has come for triple-A free-to-play games on mobile like The Division: Resurgence.

articles.caption: A look at twitter engagement for H1 2022.
articles.title: Twitter Gaming reports record conversation volume for first half of 2022
articles.description: In the first half of 2022, there were approximately 1.5 BILLION Tweets about gaming ‚Äì a record half following up on a record year for gaming conversation in 2021.

articles.caption: A look at a deep dive into Stumble Guys by Naavik.  Clones on clones on clones.
articles.title: Stumble Guys Finds Its Footing ‚Äî Naavik
articles.description:
Stumble Guys sounds ‚Ä¶ eerily familiar? In this issue, we examine the latest 
Fall Guys clone that is taking hypercasual gaming by a storm. We also 
feature the entirety of our Garena Free Fire game deconstruction from 
Naavik Pro.

articles.caption: A look at a deep dive into Free Fire, again, by Naavik.  This one is a good one.
articles.title: Free Fire: Bringing Battle Royale to the World ‚Äî Naavik
articles.description:
Free Fire is a battle royale game that has taken the world by storm. We 
take a look at what led to the game's rise, it's prominence in key regions, 
dig into the game design, and discuss what the team could do if it wants 
Free Fire to stay on top.

articles.caption: A look at Steam Deck's open-platform structure.  A small opening in the walled garden
articles.title: The Steam Deck breaks open gaming's walled garden history
articles.description: It is an open framework that provides access to a wide variety of other platforms and capabilities.

articles.caption: A look at a new way of gaming with Walking Dead by GenVid.  Massively online and live entertainment where user actions have pervasive impacts.
articles.title: Facebook's The Walking Dead Last Mile challenges how video games work

articles.caption: A look at US gamers bullish on the metaverse.  But it's odd that gamers are agaisnt blockchain and NFTs
